page.title: 10Keverstone Grange 2.
page.content: Mr and Mrs Littlefair are young progressive farmers,although they appreciate and use the old buildings they have recently built a new complex of buildings including a large byre for winter housing a modern milking parlour,a silage pit and a slurry lagoon.Recently 10 of their 151 acres have been taken by the N.C.B. for opencast mining,but the remainder is used for grazing their herd of fresian cows and for producing silage.The Littlefairs have decided to put all their efforts into dairy cattle and silage,though they do have a milk round.They sell their milk to the Milk Marketing board from whom they buy the milk for their customers.Mr & Mrs Littlefair employ one farm hand full time and contract their silage making to an outside firm.
